column4: Woah dirty computer 169!  That's my iMac's IP address!  How do i fix that?  i already tried to change the cable!
use a DHCP service or static IPs
But this is Ubuntu!  It's supposed t owork!
My computers didn't 169 until Ubuntu 11.04!
it does, avail will allow you to publish resources over the local network without static IPs or a DHCP server, but if you want something more, you need more configuration
i have an Android.  Internet works on Ubuntu and Android.  i have an iMac.  Internet doesn't work on iMac.  It says 169.  What do i do?  It worked in 10.10 and below!
how to the different computers connect to the network/internet?
It's a direct cable between the Ubuntu laptop and the iMac.
then you need to share the internet connection
Smartphone <---> Ubuntu <---> iMac
you share the connection from ubuntu to with the mac
Yeah.  There's an Ethernet connection from Android to Ubuntu.  Then there's another Ethernet connection (Shared with other computers) from Ubuntu to iMac.  The iMac says 169.  What do i do?
so your ubuntu system has 3 network interfaces?
two.  One is Android, the other is iMac.
then how does the ubuntu system connect to the internet?
With the smartphone.
then you need follow the internet connection sharing guide to share the connection to the smart phone from the ubuntu system with the mac
but i did!  It wasn't an issue until 11.04
no version of ubuntu ever automatically bridged interfaces, you have to set that up yourself
my Ubuntu computer has 10.*.*.*!
10.* didn't do it either, you're basically setting up your ubuntu system as a router. that's not automatic
What should i do?
read through https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Internet/ConnectionSharing
but i did!
